name: Victoria Bell
preferences_in_transportation: mostly drives to work, also likes sustainable transportation
lifestyle: environmental advocate, enjoys hiking, studies occupational safety
other_description: Victoria ensures workplace safety standards and conducts training programs. She collaborates with Gloria Campbell on community safety initiatives and shares environmental interests with Stephanie Lewis.

original_plans.reflection: This is the start of a new week, and I'm looking forward to maintaining my routine while staying adaptable. Last week was focused on work at the Factory, where I conducted safety audits and trained employees on emergency procedures. I made sure to drive directly to work each day using Ave_2 without any disruptions. Although I had plans to go hiking with Stephanie Lewis over the weekend, we were both too busy to meet up. This week, I hope to reconnect with her for an outdoor adventure after work. I also need to schedule some time for personal errands, like grocery shopping at the Supermarket. Since I live alone, I’ve been keeping my routines simple but effective—balancing work, health, and social connections. I noticed that traffic in the morning tends to be smooth if I leave before 8:00, so I’ll aim to maintain that habit.
plan: Wake up at home, complete morning hygiene and light exercise.
Drive to the Factory for the 8:00-17:00 shift as the factory safety coordinator.
After work, drive to the Supermarket to stock up on groceries for the week.
Go to the Gym for an evening workout session to stay active.
Return home to prepare dinner and rest for the next day.
concepts: Morning commute via St_2 and Ave_3 is efficient before 8:00
Supermarket is less crowded in the early evening
Gym attendance peaks around 18:00 but drops after 20:00
Driving during off-peak hours allows for quicker trips across town

original_plans.reflection: This week has been a mix of routine and unexpected challenges. Yesterday's disruptions at the Supermarket and on St_1_link_2 highlighted the importance of planning with buffer times, especially during peak hours. My workout at the Gym was rewarding, but I noticed it’s best to arrive after 19:00 to avoid crowds. Stephanie and I had to reschedule our hiking plans due to her prior commitment, so I’ll aim to connect later in the week. I also need to be more mindful of congestion patterns—particularly on St_1_link_2—and consider alternative routes when traveling between the Factory and other facilities. Overall, maintaining flexibility while keeping my work and wellness routines will be key this week.
plan: Wake up and complete morning hygiene, light exercise, and prepare for the day.
Drive to the Factory for the 8:00-17:00 shift as factory safety coordinator; avoid previous congestion on Ave_3.
Head to the Supermarket after work to handle grocery needs; allow extra time for potential queues.
Go to the Gym after errands to ensure evening physical activity; timing adjusted to avoid crowding.
Visit Coffee shop to meet Stephanie Lewis who is studying there from 19:30 onwards; quick catch-up before heading home.
Return home by 22:00 for dinner and rest.
concepts: St_1_link_2 prone to unexpected congestion during daytime
Supermarket experiences long queues around lunchtime
Plan 90-minute window for combined work-errand transitions

original_plans.reflection: This week has been a mix of routine adjustments and adapting to unexpected delays. Yesterday’s congestion on St_1_link_2 and long queue at the Gym highlighted the importance of better planning for facility crowding and incorporating larger time buffers. I missed my meetup with Stephanie Lewis due to cascading delays, so today I’ll aim for more conservative scheduling. On a positive note, I successfully avoided morning traffic by revising my route to work, which shows that flexibility pays off during peak hours. This evening, I should plan to arrive at the Gym after 19:00 to avoid queues. Looking ahead, I’m excited about rescheduling my hiking plans with Stephanie for Saturday morning and will ensure I leave ample time to prepare and travel to the Museum.
plan: Wake up and complete morning hygiene, light exercise, and prepare for the day.
Drive to the Factory for the 8:00-17:00 shift as factory safety coordinator; avoid previous congestion on Ave_3.
Head to the Supermarket after work to handle grocery needs; allow extra buffer time for potential queues or detours.
Go to the Gym after errands to ensure evening physical activity; timing adjusted to arrive after 19:00 to avoid crowding based on past experience.
Return home by 22:00 for dinner and rest.
concepts: Arriving at the Gym after 19:00 avoids peak crowds
Route flexibility is crucial when facing unexpected congestion on primary links
Gym often has long queues when arriving before 18:30
St_1_link_2 frequently experiences severe congestion during morning commute

revised_plans.reflection: I finished my work shift at the Factory and am now ready to plan for the rest of the evening. There is no current congestion in the transportation network, which means I can proceed with my planned errands and activities without route disruptions. Stephanie Lewis is currently heading to the Gym and mentioned earlier that it’s less crowded after 19:00, aligning well with my existing plan to arrive at 18:45. However, since she is already en route and likely ahead of me, I should consider a slight delay to ensure I actually arrive post-19:00 as originally intended. The Supermarket was visited by Stephanie during her lunch break, suggesting potential queuing during typical shopping hours, so visiting later in the evening may be more efficient.
plan: Head to the Supermarket immediately after work to handle grocery needs; take advantage of potentially reduced queue times following midday rush.
Go to the Gym after errands to ensure evening physical activity; timing maintained to arrive after 19:00 to avoid peak crowds based on past experience and recent discussion with Stephanie Lewis.
Return home by 21:30 for dinner and rest, ensuring arrival before 22:00.
concepts: Supermarket typically experiences higher foot traffic around midday
Gym often has long queues when arriving before 18:30

revised_plans.reflection: At 17:45, I have just completed my work shift at the Factory and am ready to proceed with my evening plans. The current traffic state indicates only light congestion on Ave_3_link_3 (Node_2 → Node_11) with a wait time of 4 minutes, which is not significant enough to impact my planned route. My revised plan from 17:30 remains valid: I will head directly to the Supermarket, taking advantage of reduced midday foot traffic based on Stephanie Lewis’s earlier visit. Afterward, I will go to the Gym, arriving just as it becomes less crowded after 19:00, as confirmed by both past experience and recent discussions with Stephanie. No unexpected events are currently affecting my schedule.

daily_reflections.reflection: My morning commute required a route change due to unexpected congestion on St_1_link_2, but the revised path via St_2 and Ave_2 avoided delays. The biggest disruption came during lunch when the Supermarket had an unexpectedly long queue, causing a 77-minute delay. While meeting Stephanie Lewis there was socially rewarding, I underestimated service times at the Supermarket and should build in more buffer time for errands. Evening travel from the Gym faced another severe congestion on St_1_link_2, forcing a last-minute detour through Ave_4 and Metro_2 links. Despite these challenges, most activities were completed with only minor schedule adjustments. My personal well-being remained positive overall—socializing during errands and completing my workout helped balance the day's stress points.
concepts: St_1_link_2 prone to unexpected congestion during daytime
Supermarket experiences long queues around lunchtime
Gym has extended wait times when arriving after 17:30
Plan 90-minute window for combined work-errand transitions

daily_reflections.reflection: Today's schedule required significant adjustments due to both traffic congestion and unexpected delays at the Gym. I successfully avoided morning traffic by revising my route to work, prioritizing less congested roads. However, the long queue at the Gym caused cascading delays, forcing me to miss my planned meetup with Stephanie Lewis at the Coffee shop. Despite clear roads later in the evening, the initial wait significantly impacted my ability to maintain social commitments. On a positive note, I managed to complete my workout and will be returning home only slightly later than intended. Future planning must include better awareness of facility crowding patterns and incorporating larger time buffers for personal activities.
concepts: St_1_link_2 frequently experiences severe congestion during morning commute
Gym often has long queues when arriving before 18:30
Arriving at the Gym after 19:00 avoids peak crowds
Coffee shop meetup timing should consider friend availability and travel patterns
Route flexibility is crucial when facing unexpected congestion on primary links

plan_revision_description:
Time: 07:30
Reflections: 
The current traffic state shows severe congestion on St_1_link_2 (Node_9 → Node_13) with a wait time of 11 minutes, which is part of my planned route from Uptown apartment to Factory via St_2 and Ave_2. This will significantly delay my commute if I proceed as scheduled. Gloria Campbell is already avoiding central roads by taking Ave_4_link_1 and St_4_link_2, which aligns with yesterday’s observation that Ave_4_link_1 remains clear in the early morning. Given my safety-conscious nature and preference for reliability, I should adjust my route to avoid the congested segment and ensure timely arrival at work. Additionally, Stephanie Lewis has rescheduled our hiking plans to Saturday morning, so there's no urgency to make up time today for evening activities.
